result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny C Coggon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence. If revoked, credit for time served.
Consecutive to: Ct 5 and any other sentence currently serving.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent. Absolute sobriety.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Domestic abuse assessment and counseling deemed necessary by your agent.  Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnny C Coggon

records.addlTxt: As to Count 5 to reflect 1 year probation.
from DOC re: sentence structure as to Count 5.

10:14 a.m.   Defendant Johnny C. Coggon in court, and in custody.  Attorney Addison R. Kuhn in court for defendant.  Lucas P. Bennewitz for the State of Wisconsin appearing for ADA R. Rutz in court.  Court Reporter; Darlene Shue.  

Ct 1: 4 years Wisconsin State Prison, 2 years Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision; imposed and stayed for 3 years probation; sentencing to run consecutive to any sentence currently being served

Ct 5  1 year Racine County Jail; imposed and stayed for 2 years probation; if revoked this will run consecutive to Ct 1 and any other sentence currently being served

Conditions of probation:
Absolute Sobriety;
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substance your subjected to random testing;
Full-time employment
Comply with any other programming deemed necessary by your agent. 
Domestic abuse assessment and counseling deemed as necessary by your agent. 
Firearm and Voting warning 
CIP eligible
SAP eligible
CC+DNA
Does not plan to seek postconviction relief.

PLEA: Cts. 1 & 5: G
BTC: Cts. 1 & 5: GUILTY.  Cts. 2, 3, 4: DRI.
PSI ordered.

BTC: Good cause found to waive time limits, set for a status.
Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on February 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim S.W. (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:49 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Johnny C Coggon appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Alexander J. Kostal appeared in court for Johnny C Coggon. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
